apis.description:
A paginated list of collaborations the current user has access to in the
context of the course provided in the url. NOTE: this only returns
ExternalToolCollaboration type collaborations.

  curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/1/collaborations/

operations.notes:

apis.description: A paginated list of the collaborators of a given collaboration

operations.notes: A paginated list of the collaborators of a given collaboration

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
- "collaborator_lti_id": Optional information to include with each member.
  Represents an identifier to be used for the member in an LTI context.
- "avatar_image_url": Optional information to include with each member.
  The url for the avatar of a collaborator with type 'user'.

apis.description:
A paginated list of the users who can potentially be added to a
collaboration in the given context.

For courses, this consists of all enrolled users.  For groups, it is comprised of the
group members plus the admins of the course containing the group.

operations.notes:

id.description: The unique identifier for the collaboration

collaboration_type.description: A name for the type of collaboration

document_id.description: The collaboration document identifier for the collaboration provider

user_id.description: The canvas id of the user who created the collaboration

context_id.description: The canvas id of the course or group to which the collaboration belongs

context_type.description: The canvas type of the course or group to which the collaboration belongs

url.description: The LTI launch url to view collaboration.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the collaboration was created

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the collaboration was last modified

type.description: Another representation of the collaboration type

update_url.description: The LTI launch url to edit the collaboration

user_name.description: The name of the user who owns the collaboration

id.description: The unique user or group identifier for the collaborator.
